metadata.title: Convert RPM to Hertz – Rotation to Frequency Converter
metadata.description: Convert rotation rate from Revolutions Per Minute (RPM) to Hertz (Hz), useful for electrical frequency calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms mechanical rotation rate to electrical frequency.
Machinery RPM converts to Hz frequency for electrical system analysis.
This converter uses the relationship where 60 RPM equals 1 Hertz.
methodology: 60 RPM = 1 Hz. To convert RPM to Hz, divide by 60.
Frequency understanding essential for variable frequency drives and motor control.
Understanding RPM to Hz conversion is essential for drive design.
This converter provides precise frequency conversion.

faqs.question: Why convert RPM to Hz?
faqs.answer: Electrical control: VFD (Variable Frequency Drive) uses Hz. Output measured in RPM.

faqs.question: What's a VFD?
faqs.answer: Device changing AC frequency. Controls motor speed by changing input Hz.

faqs.question: Can I exceed rated frequency?
faqs.answer: No. Exceeds motor design limits. Risk of overheating and failure.

faqs.question: What happens at low frequency?
faqs.answer: Cooling fan operates at low speed. Motor may overheat if running too slow.

faqs.question: How do I calculate output speed?
faqs.answer: Output RPM = (Input Hz × 120) / Number of poles. Pole count varies.

faqs.question: What's slip in AC motors?
faqs.answer: Difference between synchronous and actual speed. Typically 3-5% of rated.

faqs.question: How do I measure RPM?
faqs.answer: Tachometer, optical sensor, or calculated from electrical frequency.

faqs.question: What limits motor speed?
faqs.answer: Design frequency, cooling capacity, mechanical strength, load requirements.
